content:
The Challenge: AuraSense AI, a Silicon Valley startup, developed a breakthrough heart-rate monitoring ring but hit a 'scaling wall.' Local US-based prototyping was costing them $140 per unit, far exceeding their target retail price point. To survive their Series A launch, they needed to scale to 50,000 units in under 4 months while maintaining medical-grade quality standards.

üí° The Solution

Illuminious deployed our China Plus Two Strategy to provide both speed and scale. Key elements included:

  • Rapid NPI (Shenzhen): Completed 3 design iterations and DFM optimization in just 14 days.
  • Scale Production (Batam): Transitioned mass production to our Indonesia hub to leverage lower costs and 0% US tariffs.
  • Custom Test Jigs: Engineered automated optical and electrical test stations to validate sensitive biometric sensors at scale.

üîç How We Did It

1. DFM & Component Optimization (Week 1-2)

Our Shenzhen engineering team identified 4 component alternatives that reduced BOM cost by 18% without affecting sensor accuracy. Achieved DFM-ready status in 10 days.

2. Tooling & Batch Testing (Week 3-6)

Tooling was manufactured in Shenzhen and shipped to Batam. We ran a 500-unit pilot batch to validate the automated testing jigs and assembly SOPs.

3. Mass Production Ramp (Week 7-14)

Production scaled from 5,000 units per week to 15,000 units per week. Our Batam team managed 24/7 shifts to meet the critical launch date.

"Illuminious solved our biggest nightmare: how to go from a high-cost prototype to a profitable, high-volume product. Their presence in both Shenzhen and Indonesia gave us the speed we needed and the cost structure to actually compete in the global market."

Sarah Chen, CTO at AuraSense AI
